title: Crops with Lowest Average Fuel Cost

content.question: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The graph shows the average energy-based operating costs for commercially grown crops and industrialized raised livestock in the United States. (a) Based on the information in the graph, identify the category of crops that has the lowest average fuel cost.

Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The graph shows the average energy-based operating costs for commercially grown crops and industrialized raised livestock in the United States. (a) Based on the information in the graph, identify the category of crops that has the lowest average fuel cost.
(b) Based on the information in the graph, identify the category with the lowest energy-based expense in dairy farming.
(c) Based on the information in the graph, explain why there is a difference in pesticide use between wheat farming and beef cattle production.
(d) Describe one environmental problem associated with the energy-based expense that is highest in the production of poultry.

(e) A farmer wanting to decrease the ecological footprint of the operation decides to shift from growing soybeans with traditional tillage to no-till methods. Explain how this change in business practice will affect the ecological footprint of the farm.

(f) A dairy farmer is considering installing <math alttext="P V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solar panels at the farm to help reduce the farm’s energy-based expenses. Considering the energy-based expenses shown in the graph, explain why this would or would not be an effective long-term approach for reducing energy costs.

(g) Homeowners can reduce their ecological footprint through conservation landscaping techniques. Describe how one conservation landscaping technique can reduce home electricity consumption during cold winters.

Hogs are best raised between <math alttext="14 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="21 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A farmer is concerned that higher temperatures at the farm might reduce hog growth rates. The state agricultural school provided the farmer with information about how temperature plays an important role in hog growth and their nutritional needs. Daily summer high temperatures at the hog farm range from <math alttext="20 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The farmer conducts an investigation in which hogs are kept at four different temperatures. Each group contains <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hogs, and each hog is offered the same type of feed and allowed to eat as much as it wants over seven days. The amount each hog consumes is recorded on a daily basis, and the average for each group is calculated. (i) Identify the relationship between temperature and average daily feed intake in hogs, based on the data collected.

(j) The farmer has learned that hogs raised in concentrated animal feeding operations <math alttext="open parenthesis C A F Os close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAFOs</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> may have a higher average body temperature than free-range heirloom breeds that have been raised on small farms.
